about_the_game:
STORY


A visual novel about Nastya, a sales assistant in an electronics store. Her life is full of stress: a strict boss forcing her to sell unmarketable garbage, perpetually dissatisfied customers, an endless flow of goods and paperwork... All of this can cripple even the toughest person.

The protagonist has long refused psychotherapy and antidepressants. Instead, she found another way to maintain her mental health: after a hard day's work, she relieves stress by watching a snuff video, justifying it by the fact that everything happening on the screen isn’t real.

One night she stumbles upon a new video of the murder of a young woman. After watching it, the image of the stranger sits firmly in her mind and from that moment on she cannot think of anything else...

CHARACTERS


Diana is a manager from the store where Nastya works. Like all salespeople, she tries to sell something overpriced rather than match the customer with the right product.

But who knows, maybe behind the mask of a soulless sales machine hides a completely different person?


Katya. One day a mysterious girl from the snuff video comes into the store where the protagonist works. Nastya is very happy about this sudden coincidence, but she can't even imagine how this meeting will turn out for her.

Very soon the protagonist will realize that the world of snuff videos is much closer and more dangerous than she imagined.

FEATURES

  • Yuri Visual Novel, Psychological Thriller
  • Psychological disorders
  • Screen resolution 1440x1080 px (4:3 aspect ratio)
  • An anxious dark atmosphere, which will be conveyed to the player through unusual sounds and visual effects


Add to your wishlist now and don't miss the release!

content_descriptors.notes:
The game contains scenes of violence, murder and blood
Some characters suffers from mental disorders
Suicide is mentioned in the game
Girl x girl relationships

About the Game

The protagonist has long refused psychotherapy and antidepressants. Instead, she found another way to maintain her mental health: after a hard day's work, she relieves stress by watching a snuff video, justifying it by the fact that everything happening on the screen isn’t real.

One night she stumbles upon a new video of the murder of a young woman. After watching it, the image of the stranger sits firmly in her mind and from that moment on she cannot think of anything else...

CHARACTERS


Diana is a manager from the store where Nastya works. Like all salespeople, she tries to sell something overpriced rather than match the customer with the right product.

But who knows, maybe behind the mask of a soulless sales machine hides a completely different person?


Katya. One day a mysterious girl from the snuff video comes into the store where the protagonist works. Nastya is very happy about this sudden coincidence, but she can't even imagine how this meeting will turn out for her.

Very soon the protagonist will realize that the world of snuff videos is much closer and more dangerous than she imagined.

  • Psychological disorders

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 10.10 or higher
  • Processor: 1 Gz
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL compatible card
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 10.10 or higher
  • Processor: 2.0 GHz Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.0
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

name: The Girl From The Snuff Video

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows Vista/7/8/10 (32 bit or 64 bit)
  • Processor: 1 GHz
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Graphics: DirectX® 9 Compatible Graphics Card
  • DirectX: Version 9.0
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows Vista/7/8/10 (32 bit or 64 bit)
  • Processor: 2.0 GHz Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 or DirectX 9.0c
  • DirectX: Version 9.0c
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

short_description: A visual novel about a girl who watches a snuff video to relieve stress, justifying herself with the fact that what is happening on the screen isn’t real...
